item.title: Help on server development
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“N00b1, post:3, topic:25587”]you need to download the newist version of the jdk then set your varibles then rght click edit, right click txtpad (if you got it), right click send to notepad
you should see this @echo off title (name of your server) "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\bin\java.exe" server pause
change these parts to what ever jdk you got you should have 9 if you just downloded it “jdk1.5.0_08”

change that to the file name and compile it should work[/quote]

How ironic; you tell him to download the newest jdk, and give him a compiler for the jdk 1.5.8.

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe" server

Read full topic

item.title: Help on server development
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

you need to download the newist version of the jdk then set your varibles then rght click edit, right click txtpad (if you got it), right click send to notepad
you should see this @echo off title (name of your server) "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\bin\java.exe" server pause
change these parts to what ever jdk you got you should have 9 if you just downloded it “jdk1.5.0_08”

change that to the file name and compile it should work

Read full topic
